title.narrative: 14CONFAP Comparative genomic and physiological analysis of C4 plant-microbe symbiosis

description.narrative: Miscanthus (grown in the UK) is a perrenial crop containing large amounts of carbon, that we can burn in power stations to produce energy, or digest biologically to produce useful chemicals (e.g. for production of bioplastics). Sugarcane (grown in Brazil) is a very similar crop, bred for its sugar content. Both plants have bacteria called endophytes living in their roots. The plant has a symbiotic relationship with these bacteria; some of the bacteria help the plant fix nitrogen, others may help the plant tolerate drought stress. This project aims to exchange knowledge and expertise on these endophytes including what types of endophytes are present and how they function. In the long term, this could lead to us being able to innoculate plants with specific beneficial bacteria, thereby making them more tolerant to drought, and to increase their growth.

capital-spend.percentage: To address sustainable sugar and bioenergy crop production, we propose comparative analyses of beneficial plant-bacteria symbioses in Miscanthus and sugarcane. 1. Reciprocal workshops in the UK (IBERS, JHI) and Brazil (UFRJ, EMBRAPA, UENF) to exchange plant, microbial, physiological and genomics expertise on biological nitrogen fixation (BNF) and drought tolerance conferred by bacterial endophytes in C4 crops. Student training will be included, and additional researchers invited to expand the network. 2. Exchange data on the plant (genome, transcriptome, molecular markers) and bacteria (physiological and biochemical analyses, including BNF) for comparative analyses between sugarcane and Miscanthus. 3. Run an inoculation experiment in the phenomics suite at IBERS to generate novel data. IBERS will host a UFRJ student for up to 3 months and provide training at the National Plant Phenomics Centre. 4. Prepare data for publication and develop a collaborative research proposal to ensure a long-term research network between the two countries.
